alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett; Sampson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 06 at 11:08AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...GUSTY SHOWERS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN SAMPSON...EASTERN HARNETT AND CUMBERLAND COUNTIES THROUGH NOON EST... At 1106 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking gusty showers over St. Pauls, or 11 miles east of Red Springs, moving northeast at 40 mph. Another shower was located near Pembroke. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fayetteville, Lillington, Fort Liberty, Dunn, Godwin, Pope AFB, Hope Mills, Spring Lake, Erwin, and Eastover. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall with rainfall rates of around 1.5 inches per hour is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Slow down to avoid hydroplaning and do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
